body.p: Kentucky, soldier and politician. Elkton, Kentucky, native. Son of Francis Marion Bristow and Emily Edwards Helm Bristow. Attended Jefferson College in Canonsburg, Pennsylvania. Admitted to the bar in 1854. Married to Abigail Slaughter Bristow on November 21, 1854. Major of unorganized recruits for the United States Army, near Hopkinsville, Kentucky, in August 1861. Lieutenant of the 25th Kentucky Infantry Regiment from 1861 to April 15, 1862. Colonel of the 8th Kentucky Cavalry. Assisted in the capture of John Hunt Morgan in July 1863. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1863. Helped form and led the Unconditional Union party. Assistant district attorney for Kentucky in 1865.
